text: A Mohawk's Way, also known as The Mohawk's Treasure, is a 1910 short silent black and white drama film directed by D.W. Griffith, written by Stanner E.V. Taylor and based on James Fenimore Cooper novel, and photography by G.W. Bitzer. It stars Dorothy Davenport and Jeanie Macpherson. The film portrays American cultural precepts about blood-thirsty savage American Indians, and it assails the white man's cruelty against them. ==Cast== ==References== ==External links== * Category:American silent short films Category:American black-and-white films Category:1910 drama films Category:1910 films Category:American drama films Category:Films directed by D. W. Griffith Category:Films with screenplays by Stanner E.V. Taylor Category:Films based on works by James Fenimore Cooper Category:Biograph Company films Category:Films shot in New Jersey Category:American films
title: A Mohawk's Way
